context_bundle.summary: TCP/IP stack is OS-level (Windows: tcpip.sys), NOT NIC-based. NIC handles Layer 1-2 (physical/data link). OS handles Layer 3-4 (IP routing, TCP congestion control). Changing NIC preserves all TCP configuration. NIC offloads assist but don't replace the stack.

onboarding.quick_start: TCP config survives NIC change. NIC = new pipe, OS = plumbing logic. Check stack settings: netsh int tcp show global
common_patterns: NIC: Physical signals, MAC addressing, frame TX
OS Stack: IP routing, TCP congestion, window sizing
Offloads: Hardware assist for checksums, segmentation
Driver update may reset NIC-specific settings, not stack

technical_details.key_point: New NIC inherits existing TCP configuration automatically
